message.content:
cs.SI, cs.SOC, cs.CL, cs.CYBER, cs.DL

The paper analyzes news consumption and polarization on Facebook related to Brexit, which involves social media analysis (cs.SOC) and natural language processing techniques such as sentiment analysis (cs.CL). The authors also introduce a new technique combining topic extraction and sentiment analysis, which falls under the category of machine learning (cs.DL). Additionally, the paper discusses the impact of selective exposure and confirmation bias on content consumption, which relates to cybersecurity (cs.CYBER) and social influence (cs.SI).
